Key Arguments: The government should not decide what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
Misinformation is subjective and often changes with new information, as seen during COVID-19.
The proposed legislation is seen as an attack on free speech and could lead to censorship.
The government's involvement in regulating speech is concerning and could lead to authoritarian control.
Resources spent on this legislation could be better used to improve the lives of disadvantaged people.
Notable Quotes: Misinformation as defined by who? It does not concern me in the slightest.
The greatest misinformation was actually peddled by main stream media, government and public officials.
The attack on free speech is clear in this finding.
Waste of time, effort, energy and money.
